title: Donald Trump is more popular than ever with white evangelicals
content: Allegation of a dalliance with a porn star do not det the president’ most faithful supporter even slightly IN CASE anyone should think American white evangelical are actual in favour of extra-marital affair with porn stars, Robert Jeffress, a well-known pastor from Texas, offe a helpful explain last month. “Evangelical still believe in the commandment, Thou shall not have sex with a porn star”, he told Fox News. “However, wheth thi president violat that commandment or not i total irrelevant to our support of him.” It wa useful to have thi clear thi up. Since Stephanie Clifford, a porn star who i also known a Stormy Daniels, alleg that she had had a sexual tryst with Donald Trump on month aft hi third wife gave birth, the president appear to have become even more popular among white evangelical than he wa before. A survey by Public Religion Research Institute (PRRI), publish thi week, suggest support among white evangelical for Mr Trump is, at 75%, at the high level ev recorded. That i much high than the president’ 42% approval rat among the general population. It i also represent a fair steady recent increase in white evangelicals’ support for Mr Trump. Le than half back him dur the Republican primaries, in 2016. But since Mr Trump became president their support ha not dropp below 65%. Robert Jones, chief executive of PRRI, said that fit a familiar establish pattern: evangelical tend to clust behind whoev emerg a the Republican candidate in a given race—and clust even more forceful when that candidate win office. But it seem remarkable that white evangelical could be so unfaz by Mr Trump’ lat scandals. Last month, M Clifford fil a lawsuit against the president in an effort to be free of a hush agreement she had sign with hi attorney. Also last month, a form Playboy model call Karen McDougal gave a television interview in which she describ an alleg 10-month-long affair with Mr Trump in 2006 (which wa also the year of hi alleg tryst with M Clifford). M McDougal claim that the president had offe h money aft their first sexual encount and that she end the affair because she became consum with guilt about hi adultery. The White House ha den that Mr Trump had the alleg affairs. Perverse though it seems, it i no coincidence that the president’ popularity with white evangelical ha increas amid these scandals. White evangelical are a fad force in American politic and society and Mr Trump ha cast himself a their defender. So when he com und attack, they consid themselv to be und attack too. A PRRI survey conduct last year found the proportion of American who are white evangelical had fallen to 17%, from 23% in 2006. The interven year featur anoth development, the introduction of gay marriage, which for many conservative Christian i both emblematic of their decline and exceptional aggravating. Mr Trump ha signall hi sympathy for such cultural fear by vow to exclude transgend people from the arm forces. He ha also align himself firm with the pro-life movement, includ by address an annual anti-abortion march in Washington and appoint conservative judges. The aggressive mann in which he ha claim to be lead a counter-cultural pushback seem to go down with white evangelical especial well. “Trump i like the boy who punch the bul in the playground”, say Mr Jones. “They like that”. A longstand idea that white evangelical are most concern about the moral charact of their lead has, in the process, gone out the window. In a recent interview with Politico Tony Perkins, the president of the Fami Research Council, an influential Christian campaign group, said Mr Trump’ relationship with evangelical wa “transactional”. He suggest evangelical had got much out of the deal, with Mr Trump deliver more on policy, “than any oth president in my lifetime.” Thi i a big reason why Mr Trump’ approval rate have stay remarkab steady, despite the many scandal buffet hi administration. Evangelical are one of the bigg segment of hi coalition and they are go nowhere. The PRRI survey also found that 69% of white evangelical Protestant who identify with or lean toward the Republican Party would pref Donald Trump ov any oth candidate to be the party’ presidential nominee in 2020.

eg2: a fair deal/wage/price/question
公平交易；合理的工资；公道的价格；恰当的问题

Was it really fair to him to ask him to do all the work?

It's not fair on the students to keep changing the timetable.

It's only fair to add that they were not told about the problem until the last minute.

eg2: This is much like our  "starvation diets" -- and with similar results.
这非常类似于我们的时尚“饥饿节食”—— 并且有着类似的结果。
In an age of fad diets, where weight loss is society’s epicenter, and deprivation is the only way to achieve it, it’s a comfort to know that there is still room for small indulgences.
在一岁一下的时尚饮食中，哪里可以减轻体重哪里就是社会的震中，并且实现它，剥夺就是唯有出路。 知道这里还有余地小小的放任是很安慰的。
But with the Goldilocks approach, there is no need to diet to distraction. "Every single fad diet is total rubbish, " Green said, but there is merit to eating low glycemically.
但是随着外国快餐的到来，再没有必要为饮食去分心“每个时尚的饮食都是垃圾”格林说，但是吃低热量的产品是值得称赞的。
ex: n. 时尚；一时的爱好；一时流行的狂热
网络 归根到底不会引起它的关怀
